trans-unit.source: Calculates a new date/time by adding/subtracting a specified number of time intervals from an initial date/time

seg-source.mrk: Calculates a new date/time by adding/subtracting a specified number of time intervals from an initial date/time

target.mrk: Calculates a new date/time by adding/subtracting a specified number of time intervals from an initial date/time

trans-unit.source: D - Add/subtract days to/from the specified date

seg-source.mrk: D - Add/subtract days to/from the specified date

target.mrk: D - Add/subtract days to/from the specified date

trans-unit.source: M - Add/subtract months to/from the specified date

seg-source.mrk: M - Add/subtract months to/from the specified date

target.mrk: M - Add/subtract months to/from the specified date

trans-unit.source: Y - Add/subtract years to/from the specified date

seg-source.mrk: Y - Add/subtract years to/from the specified date

target.mrk: Y - Add/subtract years to/from the specified date

trans-unit.source: w - Add/subtract Weeks to/from the specified date

seg-source.mrk: w - Add/subtract Weeks to/from the specified date

target.mrk: w - Add/subtract Weeks to/from the specified date

trans-unit.source: h - Add/subtract hours to/from the specified date

seg-source.mrk: h - Add/subtract hours to/from the specified date

target.mrk: h - Add/subtract hours to/from the specified date

trans-unit.source: n - Add/subtract minutes to/from the specified en date

seg-source.mrk: n - Add/subtract minutes to/from the specified en date

target.mrk: n - Add/subtract minutes to/from the specified en date

trans-unit.source: s - Add/subtract seconds to/from the specified date

seg-source.mrk: s - Add/subtract seconds to/from the specified date

target.mrk: s - Add/subtract seconds to/from the specified date

trans-unit.source: Number of intervals to be added/subtracted (use unary minus for subtraction)

seg-source.mrk: Number of intervals to be added/subtracted (use unary minus for subtraction)

target.mrk: Number of intervals to be added/subtracted (use unary minus for subtraction)

trans-unit.source: Initial date in the format YYYY/MM/DD[ HH:MM:SS]

seg-source.mrk: Initial date in the format YYYY/MM/DD[ HH:MM:SS]

target.mrk: Initial date in the format YYYY/MM/DD[ HH:MM:SS]

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: Valid initial date must be between "2000/01/01 00:00:00". and "3000/12/31 23:59:59".

seg-source.mrk: Valid initial date must be between "2000/01/01 00:00:00".

target.mrk: Valid initial date must be between "2000/01/01 00:00:00".

trans-unit.source: The function will not return an invalid date. For example, if 3 months are added to '2004/1/31' then the result will be '2004/04/30'.

seg-source.mrk: The function will not return an invalid date.
For example, if 3 months are added to '2004/1/31' then the result will be '2004/04/30'.

target.mrk: The function will not return an invalid date.
For example, if 3 months are added to '2004/1/31' then the result will be '2004/04/30'.

trans-unit.source: See _DateTimeSplit() for other possible variations of the input date format.

seg-source.mrk: See _DateTimeSplit() for other possible variations of the input date format.

target.mrk: See _DateTimeSplit() for other possible variations of the input date format.

trans-unit.source: Calculated eventlogdate which returns second since 1970/01/01 00:00:00

seg-source.mrk: Calculated eventlogdate which returns second since 1970/01/01 00:00:00

target.mrk: Calculated eventlogdate which returns second since 1970/01/01 00:00:00
